properties.tree_description:
Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Previous leader failure with visible decay and wood loss. Additional pruning/breakage event present at a dog-leged moment on the main trunk. The tree is also in immediate proximity to the house.
		
		
			Tree number:2Species:White Oak Tree Size (DBH):22Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Two basal wound sites present. Sounding at the front wound confirms hidden internal decay and sloughing bark. The rear wound appears to be an older, inactive wound. Higher in the canopy, a sharply co-dominant union is present with several feet of bark inclusion.
		
		
			Tree number:3Species:White Oak Tree Size (DBH):16Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Dead tree
		
		
			Tree number:4Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):21Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Slight lean toward the street. Mid-bole split consistent with lightning strike, with overlapping seams forming a figure-11 / wound pattern. Sharply co-dominant upper leader present with several feet of included bark. Older rubbing/abrasion wound present higher in the canopy.
		
		
			Tree number:5Species:Water Oak Tree Size (DBH):15Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Appears to be a co-dominant basal sprout with the original co-dominant stem previously removed. Visible basal cavity present. Remaining stem exhibits decay with visible wood loss.
		
		
			Tree number:6Species:Japanese Magnolia Tree Size (DBH):10Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Overall lean greater than 20 degrees. Thje tree is also growing within 5 feet of the occupied structure.
		
		
			Tree number:7Species:BeechTree Size (DBH):24Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Opposing cavities present with visible decay and wood loss. Longitudinal trunk wound consistent with lightning strike or mechanical damage, with visible decay observed.
		
		
			Tree number:8Species:Poplar Tree Size (DBH):19Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Previously lost co-dominant trunk. Substantial old mechanical wound present on the lower bole, consistent with historic mechanical damage.
		
		
			Tree number:9Species:Northern Red Oak Tree Size (DBH):21Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Two primary co-dominant leaders extending over driveway and vehicular ingress/egress with included bark at the union. Upper canopy exhibits a lean greater than 20 degrees, with the upper center of the canopy offset approximately 25 feet from the basal area.
		
		
			Tree number:10Species:Poplar Tree Size (DBH):24Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Sizable pruning wound at the primary leader attachment with visible decay and wood loss extending close into the main stem. The tree is also in immediate proximity to the house.
